it.polimi.se2019.controller.statePattern

Class GrabStuffStateGrab

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.se2019.controller.statePattern.GrabStuffStateGrab
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    State

    public class GrabStuffStateGrab
extends java.lang.Object
implements State
    Author:
    LudoLerma, FedericoMainettiGambera this class implements the GrabStuffStateGrab which makes possible for the users to grab ammo card or weapon card

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void askForInput(Player playerToAsk) 
      void doAction(ViewControllerEvent viewControllerEvent)
      this function discern whether the player is in a normal square, so that they will be grabbing a ammo card or in a spawn point square, so that they will be grabbing a weapon card in the first case the player will just grab the ammo card in the second case it will be asked to the player to choose the weapon they want to draw (in case there are more than one)
      private AmmoCard grabAmmo()
      make the player draw a ammocard
      private State handFull()
      change state if the ammo card contains a power up
      void handleAFK()
      set the player AFK in case they don't send required input in a while no input is asked in this state, so we will have to wait the next one to find out!
      private State ifNormalSquareIsEmpty() 
      private State playerInNormalSquare()

      • doAction

        public void doAction(ViewControllerEvent viewControllerEvent)
        this function discern whether the player is in a normal square, so that they will be grabbing a ammo card or in a spawn point square, so that they will be grabbing a weapon card in the first case the player will just grab the ammo card in the second case it will be asked to the player to choose the weapon they want to draw (in case there are more than one)
        Specified by:
        doAction in interface State
        Parameters:
        viewControllerEvent - is left unread since unneeded

      • playerInNormalSquare

        private State playerInNormalSquare()
        Returns:
        the following state to be set this function take cares of the situations that can occur if the player happen to be in a normal square

      • ifNormalSquareIsEmpty

        private State ifNormalSquareIsEmpty()
        Returns:
        the following state to be set this function take care of the situations that can occur if the normal square in which the player is happen to be empty

      • handFull

        private State handFull()
        change state if the ammo card contains a power up
        Returns:
        the following state to be set

      • handleAFK

        public void handleAFK()
        set the player AFK in case they don't send required input in a while no input is asked in this state, so we will have to wait the next one to find out!
        Specified by:
        handleAFK in interface State
